video.title: 20 Award-Winning JavaScript Games – js13kGames 2021 Winners
video.description:
Js13kGames is a JavaScript coding competition where people create games UNDER 13 kilobytes. Learn about the competition and see the 2021 winners in this video.

✏️ This video is made by Ania Kubow. Check out her channel here: https://www.youtube.com/aniakubow

🔗 If you would like to see all the winners and their GitHub repos, please visit: https://js13kgames.com/#winners

No.20: Kimbatt
Twitter: n/a

GitHub: https://github.com/Kimbatt/js13k-2021

topLevelComment.author: Leonardo Ribeiro
topLevelComment.text: Begginer here: how the hell these people make so much with 13kb? I want to participate, but 13kb is smaller than a single sprite from what i know.

replies.author: Rei Ayanami
replies.text:
It's simple really, the package is measured after zipping so it's 70-odd KB of code, much more than 13. And graphics you need to generate on the fly, which is also not a huge deal tbh. Myself I never ran into the size limitation in js13k, only the deadline.

(I am in this vid, yeah.)

replies.author: Temirlan
replies.text: I recommend you search for how NES games were made, they were packed in 40kB
